intro: Elatostema mabienense var. mabienense, commonly known as the small-leaved elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Elatostema mabienense var. mabienense is often found in tropical rainforests and is known for its ability to form dense ground cover.
